website_summaries.verdict: An at-home detail kit that gets the job done.
pros: All 4 products in this kit work together to produce a polished car that will gleam from your garage
Customers note the quality results as well as the kits' adaptation to many car types
A great kit for beginners too
cons: Pads may take some time to break in

customer_reviews.title: Fine while it lasted...which was one vehicle......
customer_reviews.text: These pads worked fine while they lasted.....which was one car. I have been buffing vehicles for years. Orange (compounding) pad, and Black (fine polish) pad came away from the Velcro backing after just about one full vehicle buff. Poor quality, and it should be expected to get more than a single use out of these pads for the price. I should have listened to the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Not a bot

customer_reviews.title: rated 2 for the cleaner it works great
customer_reviews.text: Used once and the pads are falling apart, rated 2 for the cleaner it works great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They seem to hold up a little bit better than the pads I purchased at Harbor Freight which ...
customer_reviews.text: All pads seem to fit my Chicago Electric 6" dual action polisher I bought at Harbor Freight and work as described. They seem to hold up a little bit better than the pads I purchased at Harbor Freight which are less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Baummer

customer_reviews.title: i detailed my wifes entire car and used all 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: i detailed my wifes entire car and used all 3 pads. no problems at all. they're a little stiff at first bt you can break them in with water before use or they will soften up after a panel or two
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hex logic orange pads are not durable for paint correction/cutting
customer_reviews.text: I would have given 5 stars as the cleaner and polisher pads work great. However the orange cutting pad is useless. I have a Porter Cable 7424XP. While using Meguiar M105 ultra cut compound to correct some minor scratches and paint correction on my car, the middle section of both orange pads started to melt. See attached pic. I ended up with thicker Lake County orange pads to finish the job and they worked fine. I think these things hex logic pads are only good for light polishing.
customer_reviews.author: R31public

customer_reviews.title: Not 5.5" and NOT of acceptable quality
customer_reviews.text: The white pad completely came apart after about 10 minutes of use. I can tell that the orange pad is about to come apart as well. Plus the velcro backers are pulling off them so they wouldn't be usable anyway. Also, these are FIVE INCH pads, not 5.5" like they state. It even says 5" on the package so this listing is misleading. Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: SteveF

customer_reviews.title: I love Chemical Guys
customer_reviews.text: Pads are great, the hex design is great for cutting, but my favorite is the cleaner. After you use the pad, spray with the cleaning solution and with warm water agetste the pade and keep rinsing until all of the wax is out and air dry. I am using this pad with a 5" backing and the CG 5.5 pads on a Porter Cable DA. I think I have found the perfect balance for any type of minor paint correction.
customer_reviews.author: Maymar

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for 3 Hex Logic pads and cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Pads worked great and the cleaner is stronger than I thought, now I know you only need a few sprays to create plenty of lather to get the pads clean because the first time I used it I used 5 or 6 sprays and ended up with a TON of suds! All in all a great value, the white pad was especially great in removing those light scratches that are pretty much unavoidable on clear vinyl protective wrap even with careful hand washing. The orange pad was great too everywhere I used it for light to medium scratches and swirls. Used these pads with Griot's Garage G9 Polisher and was very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Can't get them to do their job.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure I'm doing something wrong, but I feel as though a wool pad would give me one less variable to identify as the problem. I have used these to try to remove hairline scratches in my clearcoat with various different polishes, never to any avail. All it leaves me is foam fragments as the pads disintegrate. I've also tried polishing countertops, which is where I have noticed it working, but never to a full gloss. It's always left hazy, even with the highest "grit" pad and compound. I regret not buying what's been the industry standard for generations.
customer_reviews.author: Trey Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: The pads came packaged well, however, before even using the pads my orange pad was not centered correctly on the Velcro backing and the black finishing pad was coming off of the Velcro backing. Will not purchase again and will go with a Lake country brand or something better than Hex Logic.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Hand buffing works better avoid swirl marks
customer_reviews.text: Can't say it's the best product I've used but it actually left swirl marks all over my car. I followed exact instructions as shown in video step by step! It looks great in the dark or cloudy day but when the sun shines it'll show swirl marks. Not a happy camper & the results was a failed mission. I had also read other reviews about this product & boy were they right about it. I need professional help with this stuff. Definitely not made for dark colored vehicles or black. I still believe hand buffing is better than the buffer machine itself.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chang

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: **This is totally subjective** As a non-professional user. the pads worked very well for me. I have used them with Meguiar's compound and polish and I was very satisfied with the results. To get the best out of them, make sure the surfaced you're working on is very clean and Clay barred or else the polisher with be very difficult to use. Also, make sure you clean the pads after each section to keep the polisher running smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Abather Shnewer

customer_reviews.title: They are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Only as good as your tools is a bunch of nonsense. However, you gotta be really terrible to have these be blamed for any undesirable results. They are great quality, provide longevity and if taken care of, last longer than everything cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Snaps on Petro

customer_reviews.title: Proper use and care and they work/last for years
customer_reviews.text: These pads are amazing for a DA or Ordital. The key to keeping them going is the pad conditioner that chemical guys sells. The cleaner works great too and will take them back to original condition when you're done. I've used the same pads on 2 different vehicles multiple times and they last when used correctly. Be sure to use the conditioner and cleaner. The directions with all chemical guy products are pretty unreliable but they all have a QR code which takes you straight to a video of how to use the products properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jake B

customer_reviews.title: Great if used properly
customer_reviews.text: Watch some YouTube videos by reputable names. Like Ammo NYC, and Chemical guys. It will teach you how to get the results your looking for because a few simple things will ruin the quality of the job and / or ruin the pads. The pads ripping is from too much pressure and/or having half the pad on the panel and half the pad off the panel while spinning. If you don’t have a compressor to blow contaminants off the pad while you work then buy a few pads for bigger jobs or just polish a panel at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Justin turner

customer_reviews.title: not that great
customer_reviews.text: I used the orange pad with rubbing compound to buff out head lights this pad did not work out very well at all. It did not spin enough to buff the grime off the headlights. Even lubed the pad to see if that would help but it did not improve much at all and watered down the rubbing compound. I do not think I would by these again. I had a black and decker 5 inch buffer I bought back in the 90's it worked better than the portor cable and this pad.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bustamante

customer_reviews.title: Good beginners kit
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my first attempt to polish my car with a DA polisher. I was able to use the white pad to polish my car after clay bar. Then the black to apply wax. They worked well, got rid of minor scratches and etched water spots on the paint surface.The included cleaner was able to get the pads clean without residues. Not all manufacture have all the same color codes, black from another doesn't mean it's for finishing/waxing.
customer_reviews.author: DDmau

customer_reviews.title: Way to go chemical guys👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the world of detailing with polishers and pads.. An all I can say is the chemical guys really really did a great job with their products.. I read some reviews where they said they fell apart after one use. I personally did not experience that at all I used all 3 pads on 2 different vehicles and they worked flawless.. Easy to clean I cannot say a bad thing about them at all!! Great price great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Rw

customer_reviews.title: Superior car care products
customer_reviews.text: Chemical Guys makes many other the other products that are marketed by others. I have been using their products for several years and have been very happy with the results. I used two of the pads to polish and seal the finish on my SUV yesterday, and used the cleaner to clean a couple of pads with good results. Would definitely purchase all of these products again when needed..
customer_reviews.author: VA944S

customer_reviews.title: I really like these pads and the cleaner works really well
customer_reviews.text: I really like the CG Hex logic pads so much I purchased 2 sets (one 5" and one 6"). The pad cleaner really surprised me. It works really well to remove waxes and compounds from the pads quickly. I spray it onto the pads, brush it in with a pad brush and then wash it out and the pad comes out like new. Very pleased. The Orange pads work really well for moderate defect removal with a decent compound. Works well with my Porter Cable 8mm and my big Shurhold 3000 21mm. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: TheBigOldDog

customer_reviews.title: ZERO Stars - 2 of the 3 Pads Fell Apart During First Use
customer_reviews.text: I like Chemical Guys compound and polish, but these pads are just plain junk. During the first use (in the first TEN MINUTES!!!) the Velcro backing on both the white and orange pads failed and the pads simply fell apart. I read other reviews claiming this happened to them, but I thought it was user error. Nope, it was PURCHASER error: I bought junk. I can't comment on the cleaner. Look at the photo...there is no point in cleaning these!
customer_reviews.author: thepipe

customer_reviews.title: A really good value
customer_reviews.text: A really good deal considering what you get. These are some of the more common pads you’ll ever use and the pads alone would probably cost you more than the entire kit. I wish Chemical Guys has another set with the Conditioner instead of the cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Erick C

customer_reviews.title: Good for tough stains
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to help me remove some hard stains in my car. As I have a White Pearl paint, living in florida with it (and its bugs) has always been a challenge. I have used this kit to succesfully clean hard stains and spots, using Meguiar’s products with it. I am taking 2 stars off because I believe it should come with 5 sponges, instead of just 3 - for the price they charge.
customer_reviews.author: ct2000

customer_reviews.title: These are great for paint correction!
customer_reviews.text: I added these to my B&D polisher. I was very impressed with the texture of the pads and their durability. I have used them on three cars so far and they still look like new. The cleaning solution that is included in the kit works great and cleans the pads well, leaving them ready for the next job. I will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: RE-View

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Guys Rocks
customer_reviews.text: Just like the rest of the Chemical Guys products, these are awesome! I purchased a TORQ polisher and already had the pads, but since this bundles was only a few dollars more than the cleaner itself, i opted for some spares. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Worked great through 3 cars so far
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order after reading reviews that said the pads fell apart. I went ahead and pulled the trigger and can confirm those reviews were wrong, at least in my case. Used these pads to correct and polish 3 cars. They were a breeze to use, the worked, and thanks to the cleaner they look almost brand new still. The velcro is still perfectly attached and I feel like I can get a few more uses out of these. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Repres

customer_reviews.title: pad cleaner is only thing worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set to use for my paint correction on my car. I originally intended to only use the white with a polish to get some light swirls out but the white pad didnt do much. Changed it to the orange pad and it still didn't really get any polishing done. Had to get some griot's compound and lake country pads to do the trick. The pad cleaner is good but the pads themselves are meh
customer_reviews.author: Cody John

customer_reviews.title: These pads are great, and the cleaning solution is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: Been using a torq polisher for a while now and these pads pair well with it. I have used these pads in the past with no cleaning solution after and it was a pain to get all the residue off. It was like cleaning a paint roller trying to get all the old chemical out. This is not the case, simply spray the solution on after you done let it rest for about a minute or two and rinse off. Everything falls right out and the pad goes back to feeling original.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Pads are great. Cleaning solution is the BOMB!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the hex logic pads for a couple years, they work good for me, and I have no complaints. But that pad cleaner solution is some great stuff. It cleans out all the extra dirty polish, compound, and even wax from out of the pads. My pads are like new after cleaned. Simply amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony G

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Detailer’s Paint Correction Kit
customer_reviews.text: Great price point for this little kit. Pads are well made (as all Chemical Guys pads are) hex pattern design. Kit is composed of the main pads you’d need for correction and polishing. The pad cleaner works great at removing old product without much scrubbing. Highly recommend. Id actually suggest several of these kits. The pad should be changed out frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: The pad did a good job of doing a medium cut on my paint. However, before even finishing half of the car the center of the pad sunk in. I saw a lot of reviews complaining about durability that were older, I hoped that the issues previous purchasers had reported were corrected. Sadly, this doesn’t appear to be the case.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pads.
customer_reviews.text: If you know how to use a foam pad. Then these last. Clean easy and work great. They last if you keep product on them. Remember these arent wool. Go slow and hold flat. If they start to fall apart then your using them wrong. I did my boat and my yukon and my e46 wagon. Clean them and ready for another.
customer_reviews.author: Ttopps!

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money and and excellent set for someone new attempting paint correction
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised with this bundle. Got some light to moderate scratches out of my clear coat and even plastic with ease. I want to add that this was my first time using buffing pads and I was shocked at the results I got out of it. The cleaning solution works very well too and smells nice.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Value
customer_reviews.text: Effective and produces great quality results. Cautious of used some polishes. Used a polish with purple color and it stained the pad, even with cleaner would not completely removed. Don't skimp on cheap pads if you care about your vehicle. I only do my daily drivers and detail as a hobby and very happy with results.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Guys HEX_3KIT_6 6.5" Buffing Pad Kit (4 items), 16 Fluid_Ounces, 4 Pack
customer_reviews.text: It was very good for my particular purpose. I used the medium grit pad with my buffing machine with a glass cleaner to remove waters spots from my shower sliding glass door. It did a great job and removed the water spots. Now it looks like new and I can clearly see through the glass door.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pads, no brush?
customer_reviews.text: Great pads, came highly recommended by just about everyone. My only complaint is that this kit didn’t come with the pad brush which is required or recommended to use with the pad cleaner. Annoying and inconvenient to have to go order something else or find a suitable replacement around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Brig

customer_reviews.title: Top quality products
customer_reviews.text: The pad cleaner caught me by surprise. It cleaned the pads of broken down oxidation and paint instantly! I sprayed it on the pad and immediately rinsed it and watched all of the paint corrections wash away. There was no need to wait for it to soak into the pad although that might be a better idea. The three pads were all I needed to do my 3-step paint correction on a 98 4Runner with heavy oxidation. The pads showed no signs of degrading after multiple washes and doing an entire SUV. Highly recommend this kit!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Pads and great cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I really like Chemical Guys products. They hold up well and create good results. I own a black BMW Z4. Even though it is garage kept, black paint is still a pain to keep looking good. These pads help keeping the paint looking its best. The pad cleaner is the best in keeping the pads clean and reusable.
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: good but not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: you're paying for the name. I purchased the same hexagon pads on eBay for way cheaper and I use a clay bar lubricant to condition the buffing pads. the Ebay pads polished my cars just as good. The cars came out looking fantastic just like my wife car with the CG buffing pads. Its all a name game with them
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I am just a first time user of this type of product and I thought these were excellent. Four stars instead of five only because I don't have the experience to be a good judge but these worked a LOT better than the inexpensive pads that came with the polisher.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney E

customer_reviews.title: great set of finishing pads
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner at paint restoration, polishing, and waxing - these worked great for me. They were recommended by a professional in the industry, and after a short tutorial, I felt like I could really use the product as designed. Very happy with them, easy to clean following the steps, and durable! Will def use this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: The Truth
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these with hopes of a great product. Unfortunately that was far from the case. I was thinking that the negative reviewsi read were wrong. But they were right, these will fall apart. The Velcro backing will either fall off or the foam will come apart or disform. I got a half of a car done before they gave out. Very Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: S. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great assortment of pads for novice to advanced users
customer_reviews.text: These pads are sufficient for 90% of what I do. I've been paint correcting 3-5 cars per week for the past 2.5 months and only one car's clear coat was in bad enough condition that I needed to go buy a pad that was more aggressive than the orange pad. I'd suggest at minimum using at least 2 of any pad color to perform a job to prevent the pores from becoming clogges up by your compound. Wash them after ever use with the provided cleaner and will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Devan Hester

customer_reviews.title: great sample compound, polish and sealant/wax pads
customer_reviews.text: Great set of pads to compound, polish and sealant/wax pads, the cleaner bottle works great to clean it afterwards, wish they made a zip lock bag so i can restore it back into the bag that it came with as on the back there are descriptions of what color pad does what
customer_reviews.author: Tony S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, spend the extra money to get the best
customer_reviews.text: I love the Chemical Guys products. I purchased some cheap foam pads and after using them on one car they were trash. I then ordered this small set and will not buy any other brand now. These foam pads are a far superior product. After using them on a big vehicle they still look and feel new. Using them with other Chemical Guys products gives your paint an amazing finish when you are done. Spend the extra money and get the best pad the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas E.

customer_reviews.title: i'm a little upset
customer_reviews.text: So i'm a little upset the pads are awesome and make a great finish but don't last, I am doing a 350z "small car" and I only did the hood and roof and already the white pad is ripping so sad first Chemical Guys product I bought.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Must have for paint color correction at home.
customer_reviews.text: If your a DIY'er like me, get this this system in conjunction with compounds works great. No issues with pieces falling off or quality issues. Very solid construction it works great on my Harbor Freight DA buffer. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Quality products yield quality results !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid Chemical Guys product user and have yet to be disappointed. Saying that, I cannot find anything bad about this product, not that I would need to either. They are strong durable and do as advertised. The spray bottle is perfect for a light spray on the pad which improves its overall performance. I plan to put these on a subscribe and save at the longest duration because while they last long, it is always best to replace pads depending on their usage frequency. I look forward to purchasing more items like these.
customer_reviews.author: MajDad

customer_reviews.title: 3 months so far
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used these products and the neighbors are asking me to do their vehicles. I wasn't cleaning my pads at first and learned just how costly that can be. Now I look like a professional detailer but I'm really just a guy who wants his ride to sparkle, which it does. Highly recommend for the beginner in detailing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but doesnt last long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to buff out a small boat. The pads worked really well and the cleaner is excellent. I would definitely buy the cleaner again. I took off a star because the pads don't last long. For the money I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Missing the pad lube to make it worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Pads seemed okay but there are better ones out there for the money. I think it would be a great deal if they included the detailed spray/pad lube along with the cleaner. Returned products.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: They worked great. Added industrial Velcro and used on black and decker orbital buffer to remove water spots from car. Used Mother's #2 polish, followed with F11 Top Coat. Very shiny. Very pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Step Lively

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: This has been easy to clean so far & easy to use. I've only done a few headlight restorations with it so far but everything went well for being a complete beginner. We'll see how it does when I wax the whole car.
customer_reviews.author: J & R

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Kit
customer_reviews.text: I received the cleaner, but no buffing/polishing pads. I wrote Chemical Guys and heard nothing back from them. I am returning the cleaner for a refund, and will go with another company.
customer_reviews.author: Cooder

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Polishing pad (black) didn't last my complete BMW Z4 when all of a sudden it split in half. Thankfully I caught it before it caused any damage to the car. The yellow pad is fine, as well as the white.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Pagan, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Decent POLISHING pads.  Lack cutting power
customer_reviews.text: The stars are missing one question... cutting ability. These foam pads are decent quality. They are not going to cut it for serious paint correction. The cleaner is a good product, but don’t buy this thinking it’s the only pads you will need!
customer_reviews.author: amazon dude

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This kit was just what I needed. No need to buy extra pads. Cleaner works fantastic. Use care when removing the pads from the backing plate or the hook and loop will start to separate.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Pads are great, Pad Cleaner is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Great pads, great price, and the pad cleaner is awesome to have. I throw a little in with my towels and other detailing stuffs to help cut the dried wax/polish/etc. Used all pads once on a porter cable 7424xp and they did great. Still getting the feel for DA buffing, as I have tons of time on a rotary polisher, but I can already tell these are leaps and bounds ahead of the ol' wool pads on a rotary machine. Only complaint is that they come with no instructions whatsoever. I only knew that orange was heavy cut, white was light cut, and black was no cut because of Junkman2000 on Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: SirPaulimusMaximus

customer_reviews.title: Good pads they hold up well no problems With hook ...
customer_reviews.text: Good pads they hold up well no problems With hook and loop backing, I like the pad spray cleaner too, I would buy again. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Gray

customer_reviews.title: Cutting pad fell apart on 3rd use
customer_reviews.text: The polishing and the finishing pads have held up nicely so far, but the Orange cutting pad completely fell apart pretty quickly. It began to tear away from the velcro backing after doing only 1 car. By the 3rd time I used it, it completely separated mid-use and flew off leaving a nice mess of splattered polish for me to clean off of floor/ exterior plastic parts/ surrounding garage items, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product... my only advice is to apply the Wax with a cheap hand sponge and use these for compounding and polishing... really takes a lot of cleanup to get the Wax out of these...
customer_reviews.author: mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: They are better pads than the one that came with my buffer
customer_reviews.text: They are better pads than the one that came with my buffer. I'm still learning but my paint looks great, was able to remove some imperfections and bring out the shine.
customer_reviews.author: Jarryd Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Not the right size
customer_reviews.text: These claimed to be 6.5” and came as 6”...wouldn’t be a big deal except we needed 7” and had already gone down slightly by what it claimed. The package clearly says 6” so they should market it as such.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart After Ten Minutes
customer_reviews.text: The pads separated from their velcro base after about ten minutes of use with a long throw, dual action, orbital polisher, on speed setting 3.5. Very easy to clean with chemical brothers cleaning product.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Aggie

customer_reviews.title: BEST PAD AND LUBRICATER SETUP
customer_reviews.text: Love love love chemical guys detailing stuff! Would highly recommend buying these 5" hex buffing pads and pad cleaner. Best price as a bundle as to where you would buy it seperate and spend more. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Luke R.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Came packaged well and none of the pads were damaged. Orange pad seems comparable to the Griots garage cutting pad that I have. Price per pad is less than Harbor Freight. I'm not a big Chemical Guys fan, but this deal is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: CowboyT

customer_reviews.title: Great for price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cutting pads and cleaner bundle for the price! Not sure how long they would last doing a whole car because I just used on my motorcycle. But paint looks and feels like brand new. I'm no expert btw, but you do need a DA polisher and some decent paint correction compound. They pad cleaner seems to work very well, I should of took a before picture of the pad because it was covered in black and grey paint and compound but I only took an after, but you can see it looked brand new and very clean.
customer_reviews.author: bigfootinya1

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: No issues with these pads. They have held up well for polishing 2 complete cars and are easy to clean. They hold plenty of compound/polish and help handle residue from old paint well.
customer_reviews.author: mchannah

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Chemical Guys make some excellent products. The hexagonal polishing/buffing pads are absolutely fantastic. I recommend using the pads with a random orbital device for the best results.
customer_reviews.author: S.Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is they don’t fit my polisher. I couldn’t find any polisher/buffer for a reasonable amount this size. Measure your hook and loop before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Good kit except for the all important orange medium pad.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these pads. The black and white seem to have held up fine over two cars. The cleaner does a good job of removing spent product at the end. The orange medium cut pad is junk. Prior to completing one vehicle the pad is completely broken down in the middle and mush. Maybe it was a bad batch for the orange I got based on the other product reviews that were positive?
customer_reviews.author: Matt Haney

customer_reviews.title: Hex is Logical
customer_reviews.text: Love these Hex Logic pads. They do a great job on my paint and the different colors makes it easy to pick the right pad for the job. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: CRS

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Good pads. I polished and buffed an entire car without the pads showing any kinds of wear. The spray is nice. It really cuts through the compounds and waxes.
customer_reviews.author: GS
